abstracts.cdata!:
The Poverty Reduction Support Credit
            (PRSC) Project pursues the Government's reform efforts,
            and seeks to enhance the Government's ability to manage
            Azerbaijan's natural resources efficiently, and
            stimulate balanced economic growth, and job creation,
            fundamental to poverty reduction. To this end, the proposed
            PRSC will support selected areas of the Government's
            reform agenda, as outlined in the PRSP, and closely aligned
            with the Country assistance strategy (CAS) objectives, as
            follows: 1) In order to manage the oil boom, adequate
            policies will be pursued, namely, to avoid the Dutch
            disease, and to improve efficiency and effectiveness of the
            public resource use. 2) To prod a sustainable non-oil
            growth, and job generation, the project will improve the
            environment for increased non-oil trade, private sector
            development and investment, and, improve financial
            intermediation, while enhancing corporate governance, and
            financial discipline in the financial and corporate sectors.
            3) To improve social services and infrastructure the project
            will support improvements in utility services, by developing
            tariff policies, a modern regulatory framework, and, enforce
            payment discipline. Moreover, it will improve
            telecommunications, and transport services through
            restructuring activities, improving as well competitiveness
            aspects. The quality of basic and secondary education will
            be improved, as will access to, and quality of primary
            healthcare services, to include improved financing and
            allocation of resources in the health sector. Finally,
            effective pension and social protection programs, will be
            established. Notwithstanding, several risks exist,
            political, economic, and social, but most importantly, the
            volatility of energy prices, or unexpected delays in the
            operation of the Baku-Tbilisi-Cheyhan (BTC) pipeline and
            Shah Deniz gas projects, could seriously affect resource
            flows and public finances, and, delay implementation of
            poverty reducing measures. However, the PRSC support to
            prudent fiscal policy, and the formulation of a long-term
            oil revenue management strategy, and medium-term budget
            planning, will mitigate these risks.
